bja@... wrote:
> Hi !
> 
> We are testing HERITRIX in connection with harvesting specially selected 
> websites - when harvesting only one website (on only one host / domain) the 
> crawler is quite slow due to the limitation in HERITRIX that allows only one 
> connection pr. host - could this limit be included in the configuration? - could 
> the setting be overriden in other ways (even directly in the code)?
> 
> We are aware of the fact that the limitation is implemented so that the crawler 
> is not overloading the websites - but in our project we are planning to make 
> agreements with the website-owners and maybe only harvest during the night - so 
> we could very much need more connections !

A first step would be to eliminate the politeness delay between
requests to a single server.

To do this, in the 'frontier' section of the crawl job settings, set
'delay-factor', 'min-delay-ms', and 'min-interval-ms' settings all
to 0. Then each request will immediately follow the one before,
acquiring resources much faster than the default settings.

The assumption that we only want to make one outstanding request to a
single server is deeply integrated into aspects of our design, so I
can't immediately think of a single, easy way to relax this assumption.
It would probably involve creating multiple instance of the Frontier's
'KeyedQueue' per hostname, or assigning a KeyedQueue a 'parallelism'
value which keeps it in 'ready to supply URIs' state whenever fewer
than the given number of URIs are in-progress.

We have considered relaxing the single-outstanding request policy
for servers which clearly have multiple IPs serving a single
hostname -- in which case we would allow one outstanding request
per IP -- or moving to HTTP/1.1 pipelined requests, which would
remove the slow-start and teardown socket overheads of the one-
request-per-connection approach. However, these optimizations have
been put off to some post-1.0 release -- perhaps by the fall,
when our focus will be on broader and web-wide crawls.

Please feel free to file an enhancement request via our Sourceforge
project so that your need is tracked, including any details about
how you'd like this to be configurable.
